Description: Rim fragment of East Greek pottery lid; reserved on the interior; on the slipped exterior, from the rim: black band, frieze of dots, and part of a a floral frieze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 20, no. 66 pl. 18)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.569)
